info.description:
A simple nanoblogging platform.

HTTP cookies must be used for authentication on most routes. These can be obtained by calling the `/auth` route with the appropriate parameters.
info.title: littr

post.description: This function call acts as a procedure to authenticate an user using their credentials (nickname and hashed passphrase). On success, the pair of HTTP cookies are sent with the API response (`refresh-token` and `access-token`).

parameters.description: User's credentials to authenticate.
parameters.name: request

200.description: Authentication process successful, HTTP cookies sent in response.

401.description: User not authenticated, wrong passphrase used, or such account does not exist at all.

429.description: Too many requests, try again later.

500.description: Internal server problem while processing the request.

post.description: This function call's purpose is to sent void HTTP cookies to the caller. If the `refresh-token` sent with the request is valid, it is set to be purged from database and therefore cannot be used anymore.

200.description: Void cookies sent in response.

429.description: Too many requests, try again later.

500.description: Internal server error, try again later.

get.description: This function call is used primarily by the healthcheck function inside the Docker compose stack to periodically dump running data into the JSON files.

parameters.description: A special app's dump token.
parameters.name: X-Dump-Token

200.description: The dumping process was successful.

400.description: Invalid input data (e.g. a blank token).

429.description: Too many requests, try again later.

get.description: Calling this endpoint creates a SSE subscription to receive the server-sent event stream. The connection type is set to keep-alive, so the common request will appear as "timing-out".
get.summary: Get real-time server-sent event stream (SSE stream)

200.description: The connection success. Typically appears when the stream ends gracefully.

500.description: A generic network problem when connecting to the stream.

get.description: This function call retrieves a single page of polls according to the optional `X-Page-No` header (default is 0).

parameters.description: A page number (default is 0).

200.description: The requested page of polls is returned.

post.description: This function call handles a new poll request to the poll service, where new poll creation is ensured.

parameters.description: A new poll's simplified body.
parameters.name: request

201.description: A new poll has been created successfully.

429.description: Too many requests, try again later.

get.description: This function call retrieves a single requested poll's data. Such poll's ID is to be provided as the URL parameter.

parameters.description: A poll's ID to retrieve.

200.description: The requested poll's data returned successfully.

delete.description: This function call takes in a `pollID` parameter, which is used to identify a poll to be purged.

parameters.description: A poll's ID to be deleted.

patch.description: This function call updates the poll specified using the `pollID` parameter. The fields to be updated are the counts of the poll's options. Only a single incrementation related to the current state stored in the database is allowed to be processed.

parameters.description: A poll's body to update.
parameters.name: updatedPoll

parameters.description: A poll's unique ID.
parameters.name: pollID

200.description: The poll has been updated successfully.

429.description: Too many requests, try again later.

get.description: This function call retrieves the system and users' statistics.

200.description: Stats were calculated and are returned.

500.description: A serious problem occurred while stats were being calculated.

get.description: This function call retrieves a paginated list of user accounts. The page number starts at 0 (and is the default value if not provided in a request).

parameters.description: Page number (default is 0)
parameters.name: X-Page-No

200.description: Requested page of user accounts returned.

post.description: This function call provides a method on how to create a new user in the system.

parameters.description: The request body containing all listed fields for a new user's creation.
parameters.name: request

201.description: The request was processed successfully and an user was created.

400.description: The request body contains invalid data, or data types.

403.description: This response code may occur when the registration is disabled.

409.description: The nickname and/or e-mail fields contain data, that had been already used by someone else.

500.description: There is a problem processing the request in the internal server logic. This may occur when a new user cannot be saved to the database for example.

post.description: This function call provides a method for the new user's activation using a received UUID string in payload.
post.summary: Activate an user via an UUID string

parameters.description: A received UUID string to activate the user after the registration.
parameters.name: request

200.description: The user was activated successfully.

400.description: The request body contains invalid data, or data types.

404.description: The UUID string does not match any user in the system.

500.description: There is a problem processing the request (e.g. a problem accessing the database).

get.description: This function call retrieves an user's data that is to be specified in the URI path (as `userID` param below in the request section). A special keyword `caller` can be used to retrieve all reasonable data for the user calling the API. The identity is assured using the refresh token, which is encoded into the refresh HTTP cookie.

200.description: Requested user's data (may be limited according to the caller).

404.description: User not found in the database.

500.description: A generic problem in the internal system's logic. See the `message` KV in JSON to gain more information.

post.description:
This function call is to be used when an user forgets their passphrase and wants a new one. This very call generates a request for such reset only.

Internally, this is a mailing procedure as two mails has to be delivered and the content used with the API/client to successfully reset the passphrase. This call generates the first mail.

parameters.description: User's  e-mail address.
parameters.name: request

200.description: The passphrase reset request was created successfully.

404.description: Such user does not exist in the system.

500.description: There is an internal processing problem present (e.g. data could not be saved to the database).

post.description:
This function call is to be called when an user forgets their passphrase and wants a new one. This very call does the passphrase regeneration under the hood specifically.

Internally, this is a mailing procedure as two mails has to be delivered and the content used with the API/client to successfully reset the passphrase. This call generates the second mail.

parameters.description: Received UUID string to confirm the reset.
parameters.name: request

200.description: The passphrase was changed successfully.

404.description: Such user does not exist in the system.

500.description: There is an internal processing problem present (e.g. data could not be saved to the database).

get.description: This function call retrieves an user's data that is to be specified in the URI path (as `userID` param below in the request section). A special keyword `caller` can be used to retrieve all reasonable data for the user calling the API. The identity is assured using the refresh token, which is encoded into the refresh HTTP cookie.

parameters.description: User's ID to be shown
parameters.name: userID

200.description: Requested user's data (may be limited according to the caller).

404.description: User not found in the database.

500.description: A generic problem in the internal system's logic. See the `message` KV in JSON to gain more information.

delete.description: This function call ensures a caller's user account is deleted while all posted items (posts and polls) are purged too. Additionally, all associated requests and tokens are deleted as well.

parameters.description: ID of the user to be purged
parameters.name: userID

200.description: The submitted user account has been deleted.

403.description: Blocked attempt to cross-delete other (foreign) user account. The userID param has to be equal to the caller's nickname.

404.description: Such user does not exist in the system.

500.description: There is an internal processing problem present (e.g. data could not be saved to the database).

post.description: This function call presents a method to change one's avatar URL property while also uploading a new picture as a profile photo. Binary data and a figure's extension (JPG, JPEG, PNG) has to be encapsulated into the JSON object as base64 formatted text.

parameters.description: The data object containing the new avatar's data.
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: User's ID for avatar update.
parameters.name: userID

200.description: The avatar was uploaded and updated successfully.

403.description: Unauthorized attempt to modify a forigner's avatar.

404.description: Such user does not exist in the system.

500.description: There is an internal processing problem present (e.g. data could not be saved to the database).

patch.description:
This function call enables the caller to modify lists saved with other user's data in the database.

Those lists are KV structures, that hold another user's nickname as key, and a boolean as a value to specify whether such list should apply its logic on such user.
At least one list has to be specified.

parameters.description: Lists object data as a desired state recipe.
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: ID of the user to update
parameters.name: userID

200.description: User's lists have been updated.

403.description: This code can occur when one wants to update another user (this feature to be prepared for a possible admin panel function).

500.description: There is a processing problem in the internal logic, or some system's component does not behave (e.g. database is unavailable).

patch.description:
This function call enables the caller to modify some of their properties (options) saved in the database.

Note: the duality in the options' configuration (map vs. separated booleans) reflects the attempt for backward compatibility with older clients (v0.45.18 and older).
The preferred one is the map configuration.

parameters.description: A JSON object containing at least one option with a desired value.
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: ID of the user to update
parameters.name: userID

200.description: User's options were updated successfully.

403.description: Unauthorized attempt to modify a foreign option set.

404.description: Such user does not exist in the system.

500.description: There is an internal processing problem (e.g. data could not be saved in database).

patch.description:
This function call enables the caller to modify their current passphrase. The current and a new passphrase are to be sent (hashed using sha512 algorithm).

The problem there is on how to fetch the current passphrase. This can be achieved using a web browser in dev tools (F12), where the hash is to be found on the Network card.
Another problem is that the server uses a secret (pepper), that is appended to a passphrase before loading it into the has algorithm. This secret cannot be fetched via API, as it is a sensitive variable saved as the environmental variable where the server is run.

parameters.description: Hexadecimal representation of the sha512-hashed passphrases.
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: ID of the user to update
parameters.name: userID

200.description: User has been updated.

403.description: Unauthorized attempt to modify a forigner's passphrase.

404.description: Such user does not exist in the system.

500.description: There is an internal processing problem present (e.g. data could not be saved to the database).

get.description: This function call is a very specific combination of the users' and posts' services. It retrieves a paginated list of posts made by such user. Special restrictions are applied, such as the privacy (private account, which is not followed by the caller is shown blank). If the list is empty, ensure you are following such user/account.

parameters.description: Optional boolean specifying the request of so-called root posts (those not being a reply). Default is false.
parameters.name: X-Hide-Replies

parameters.description: Page number (default is 0).
parameters.name: X-Page-No

parameters.description: User's ID (usually the nickname).
parameters.name: userID

200.description: A paginated list of the user's posts (special restriction may apply).

500.description: A very internal service's logic problem. See the `message` field to gain more information.
